title: James Chapter 2 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on James chapter 2 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: James Chapter 2 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of James Chapter 2.

questions.question: According to James 2:1, what kind of faith should we not have with respect of persons?
options: Faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory
questions.correctAnswer: Faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory
questions.explanation: James 2:1 instructs believers not to have the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ with respect of persons, meaning without showing partiality.

questions.question: In James 2:2, who are the two types of men mentioned coming into the assembly?
options: A man with a gold ring and a poor man in vile raiment
A Pharisee and a tax collector
A rich man and a beggar
questions.correctAnswer: A man with a gold ring and a poor man in vile raiment
questions.explanation: James 2:2 describes a man with a gold ring and in goodly apparel and also a poor man in vile raiment coming into the assembly.

questions.question: What does James 2:3 say happens to the poor man in the assembly?
options: He is told to stand or sit under the footstool
He is given a seat of honor
He is invited to speak first
questions.correctAnswer: He is told to stand or sit under the footstool
questions.explanation: James 2:3 explains that the poor man is told to stand or sit under the footstool, showing partiality to the rich man.

questions.question: According to James 2:5, who has God chosen as rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom?
questions.correctAnswer: The poor of this world
questions.explanation: James 2:5 states that God has chosen the poor of this world to be rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom.

questions.question: What does James 2:6 say about how the rich treat you?
options: They oppress you and draw you before judgment seats
questions.correctAnswer: They oppress you and draw you before judgment seats
questions.explanation: James 2:6 mentions that rich men oppress believers and bring them before judgment seats.

questions.question: What is the 'royal law' mentioned in James 2:8?
options: Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself
Thou shalt keep the Sabbath holy
Thou shalt honor thy father and mother
questions.correctAnswer: Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself
questions.explanation: James 2:8 identifies the royal law as loving your neighbor as yourself.

questions.question: What does James 2:9 say happens if you have respect to persons?
options: You commit sin and are convinced of the law as transgressors
You gain favor with the people
questions.correctAnswer: You commit sin and are convinced of the law as transgressors
questions.explanation: James 2:9 states that showing partiality is sin and makes one a transgressor of the law.

questions.question: According to James 2:10, if a person offends in one point of the law, what is their status?
questions.correctAnswer: Guilty of all the law
questions.explanation: James 2:10 explains that breaking one part of the law makes a person guilty of breaking the whole law.

questions.question: What should believers do according to James 2:12 in relation to the law of liberty?
options: Speak and act as those who will be judged by the law of liberty
questions.correctAnswer: Speak and act as those who will be judged by the law of liberty
questions.explanation: James 2:12 instructs believers to speak and act in a way consistent with being judged by the law of liberty.

questions.question: True or False: James 2:13 states that mercy will have judgment without mercy.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: James 2:13 says that judgment without mercy will be given to those who show no mercy, and mercy rejoices against judgment.

questions.question: According to James 2:14, what question is asked about faith without works?
questions.correctAnswer: Can faith save him?
questions.explanation: James 2:14 questions if faith without works can save a person, implying it cannot.

questions.question: True or False: James 2:17 teaches that faith without works is alive.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: James 2:17 clearly states that faith without works is dead.

questions.question: Who is mentioned in James 2:21 as being justified by works?
questions.correctAnswer: Abraham
questions.explanation: James 2:21 cites Abraham as being justified by works when he offered Isaac on the altar.

questions.question: Complete this verse from James 2:19: 'Thou believest that there is one God; thou doest well: the devils also believe, and ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: tremble
questions.explanation: James 2:19 states that devils also believe in one God and tremble, showing belief alone is not enough.

questions.question: True or False: James 2:26 compares faith without works to a body without the spirit, saying both are dead.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: James 2:26 clearly states that faith without works is dead just as a body without the spirit is dead.

medium.title: James Chapter 2 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from James Chapter 2 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does James 2 teach us about showing partiality in the church assembly?
options: We should not show favoritism based on outward appearances
We should honor the wealthy above the poor
It is right to give the best seats to influential members
Partiality is acceptable if it helps the church grow
questions.correctAnswer: We should not show favoritism based on outward appearances
questions.explanation: James 2:1-4 instructs believers not to have faith with respect of persons, condemning favoritism towards those wearing fine clothes or gold rings. The passage teaches that partiality judges evil thoughts and is inconsistent with faith in Jesus.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with feeling unworthy because of their poverty. According to James 2, what biblical truth would you share?
options: God has chosen the poor to be rich in faith and heirs of His kingdom
The poor are less favored by God
Only the rich are blessed by God
Faith is irrelevant to one's social status
questions.correctAnswer: God has chosen the poor to be rich in faith and heirs of His kingdom
questions.explanation: James 2:5 emphasizes that God has chosen the poor of this world to be rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom promised to those who love Him. This highlights God's special care and value for the poor in His kingdom.

questions.question: What warning does James 2 give about oppressing the poor and showing favoritism to the rich?
options: Rich men oppress and drag believers before judgment seats
It is acceptable to seek help from the rich only
The poor should be ignored in the assembly
questions.correctAnswer: Rich men oppress and drag believers before judgment seats
questions.explanation: James 2:6-7 points out that rich men oppress the poor and bring them to judgment, and they also blaspheme the name of Christ. The passage warns against despising the poor and shows the danger of partiality.

questions.question: How does fulfilling the 'royal law' relate to Christian conduct according to James 2?
options: Loving your neighbor as yourself fulfills the royal law
questions.correctAnswer: Loving your neighbor as yourself fulfills the royal law
questions.explanation: James 2:8 states that if believers fulfill the royal law according to Scripture, which is 'Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself,' they do well. This highlights love as central to Christian obedience.

questions.question: What consequence does James 2 describe for those who show partiality?
options: They commit sin and are convinced as transgressors of the law
They will be honored by men
questions.correctAnswer: They commit sin and are convinced as transgressors of the law
questions.explanation: James 2:9 explains that showing respect of persons is sin and convicts one as a transgressor of the law, reinforcing that partiality is incompatible with living by God's law.

questions.question: According to James 2, what is the effect of keeping the whole law but failing in one point?
options: One is guilty of breaking all the law
It is acceptable if the rest is kept
questions.correctAnswer: One is guilty of breaking all the law
questions.explanation: James 2:10 teaches that whoever keeps the whole law but offends in one point is guilty of all, illustrating the holistic nature of obedience required by God's law.

questions.question: How should believers speak and act according to James 2?
options: As those who will be judged by the law of liberty
questions.correctAnswer: As those who will be judged by the law of liberty
questions.explanation: James 2:12 instructs believers to speak and do as those who shall be judged by the law of liberty, encouraging responsible and merciful conduct under God's gracious law.

questions.question: What does James 2 say about judgment and mercy?
options: Judgment without mercy is given to those who show no mercy
questions.correctAnswer: Judgment without mercy is given to those who show no mercy
questions.explanation: James 2:13 states that judgment will be without mercy to the one who showed no mercy, while mercy triumphs over judgment, emphasizing mercy's importance in Christian life.

questions.question: A believer claims to have faith but does nothing to help a needy brother or sister. Based on James 2, what is the biblical assessment of this faith?
options: Faith without works is dead and cannot save
Faith alone is sufficient regardless of works
Works are more important than faith
Faith is only about belief, not action
questions.correctAnswer: Faith without works is dead and cannot save
questions.explanation: James 2:14-17 teaches that faith without works is dead. Merely claiming faith without demonstrating it through actions like helping those in need is ineffective for salvation.

questions.question: What example does James 2 give to show the relationship between faith and works?
options: Abraham offering Isaac upon the altar
questions.correctAnswer: Abraham offering Isaac upon the altar
questions.explanation: James 2:21-22 uses Abraham's offering of Isaac as an example of faith working together with works, showing that faith was perfected by his action.

questions.question: How does James 2 describe the faith of demons who believe in one God?
options: They believe and tremble, but it is not saving faith
They do not believe at all
They are examples of perfect faith
questions.correctAnswer: They believe and tremble, but it is not saving faith
questions.explanation: James 2:19 states that demons believe there is one God and tremble, but this belief is not sufficient for salvation as it lacks works and obedience.

questions.question: What is the analogy James 2 uses to describe faith without works?
options: Faith without works is like a body without the spirit, it is dead
Faith without works is like a tree without fruit
Faith without works is like a lamp without oil
Faith without works is like a ship without a rudder
questions.correctAnswer: Faith without works is like a body without the spirit, it is dead
questions.explanation: James 2:26 compares faith without works to a body without the spirit, both being dead, highlighting the necessity of works to give life to faith.

questions.question: True or False: According to James 2, works alone without faith can justify a person.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: James 2:24 clarifies that a man is justified by works and not by faith only, implying faith is foundational and works complete it; works alone cannot justify apart from faith.

questions.question: True or False: James 2 teaches that faith is made perfect by works.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: James 2:22 teaches that faith is wrought with works and by works faith is made perfect, showing the essential partnership of faith and works in the believer’s life.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to James 2, 'Ye see then how that by works a man is __________, and not by faith only.'
questions.correctAnswer: justified
questions.explanation: James 2:24 states that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only, emphasizing the vital role of works in demonstrating genuine justification.

hard.title: James Chapter 2 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from James Chapter 2.

questions.question: In James 2:1, what warning is given about faith in Jesus Christ?
questions.correctAnswer: Do not show favoritism
questions.explanation: James 2:1 instructs believers not to hold the faith of Jesus Christ with respect of persons, meaning no favoritism.

questions.question: What example does James 2 use to illustrate partiality in the assembly?
options: A man with a gold ring and a poor man in vile raiment
A Pharisee and a tax collector
A rich merchant and a beggar at the temple
An elder and a young disciple
questions.correctAnswer: A man with a gold ring and a poor man in vile raiment
questions.explanation: Verses 2 and 3 describe how partiality is shown when a richly dressed man is given a good seat while a poor man is treated poorly.

questions.question: What accusation does James make against those who show partiality according to James 2:4?
options: They become judges of evil thoughts
questions.correctAnswer: They become judges of evil thoughts
questions.explanation: James 2:4 says that showing partiality makes one a judge with evil thoughts, condemning unfairly.

questions.question: According to James 2:5, whom has God chosen and what are they rich in?
options: The poor of this world, rich in faith
questions.correctAnswer: The poor of this world, rich in faith
questions.explanation: James 2:5 emphasizes that God has chosen the poor, who are rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom.

questions.question: What does James 2:6 say about the treatment of the poor by the rich?
options: Rich men oppress the poor and bring them to judgment
Rich men provide generously for the poor
Rich men pray for the poor
questions.correctAnswer: Rich men oppress the poor and bring them to judgment
questions.explanation: James 2:6 indicates that rich men oppress the poor and even bring them before courts unjustly.

questions.question: What law does James refer to in James 2:8 that, if fulfilled, results in doing well?
options: Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself
Thou shalt keep the Sabbath holy
Thou shalt honor thy father and mother
questions.correctAnswer: Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself
questions.explanation: James 2:8 calls this the royal law, highlighting love for one’s neighbor as the key to fulfilling the law.

questions.question: What is the consequence of showing partiality according to James 2:9?
options: You commit sin and are convicted by the law as transgressors
You become a leader in the church
questions.correctAnswer: You commit sin and are convicted by the law as transgressors
questions.explanation: James 2:9 clearly states that showing respect to persons is sin and makes one a transgressor of the law.

questions.question: James 2:10 teaches that breaking one part of the law has what effect?
options: Makes a person guilty of breaking all of the law
Is excusable if the rest of the law is kept
questions.correctAnswer: Makes a person guilty of breaking all of the law
questions.explanation: Verse 10 explains that offending in one point makes a person guilty of the entire law, emphasizing the law's holistic nature.

questions.question: Which two commandments does James 2:11 connect to illustrate the law’s unity?
options: Do not commit adultery and do not kill
Do not steal and do not bear false witness
Honor your father and mother and keep the Sabbath
Love God and love your neighbor
questions.correctAnswer: Do not commit adultery and do not kill
questions.explanation: James 2:11 cites these two commandments to show that breaking one breaks the whole law's moral demands.

questions.question: According to James 2:13, what will happen to those who show no mercy?
options: They will be judged without mercy
They will receive a second chance
questions.correctAnswer: They will be judged without mercy
questions.explanation: This verse states that judgment without mercy will be given to those who have not shown mercy, highlighting mercy's importance.

questions.question: What question does James ask in James 2:14 to challenge the value of faith without works?
options: Can faith save him who has no works?
Is faith more important than love?
Can works alone save a person?
questions.correctAnswer: Can faith save him who has no works?
questions.explanation: James 2:14 questions the profit or benefit of faith that lacks works, implying such faith is ineffective.

questions.question: What illustration does James use in verses 15-16 to show the emptiness of faith without works?
options: Saying 'Depart in peace' to a naked and hungry brother without providing
Building a house without a foundation
Lighting a lamp and hiding it
questions.correctAnswer: Saying 'Depart in peace' to a naked and hungry brother without providing
questions.explanation: These verses describe a brother or sister needing clothes and food, and merely offering words without meeting needs is profitless.

questions.question: How does James 2:18 propose to demonstrate faith by works?
options: Show me your faith without works, and I will show you my faith by my works
Speak only of faith and not works
questions.correctAnswer: Show me your faith without works, and I will show you my faith by my works
questions.explanation: Verse 18 presents a challenge that faith is evidenced and perfected by works, making them inseparable.

questions.question: What does James 2:19 say about demons' belief in God?
options: Demons believe there is one God and tremble
questions.correctAnswer: Demons believe there is one God and tremble
questions.explanation: This verse highlights that mere belief without works is insufficient, as even demons believe but do not obey.

questions.question: True or False: James 2:24 teaches that a person is justified by faith only, without works.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: James 2:24 explicitly states a man is justified by works and not by faith only, emphasizing the necessity of works.

theological.title: James Chapter 2 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from James Chapter 2 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to James 2:1, what is forbidden when having faith in Jesus Christ?
questions.correctAnswer: Respect of persons (partiality)
questions.explanation: James 2:1 forbids showing partiality or favoritism when having faith in Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory. This aligns with Leviticus 19:15 which commands impartial judgment, and Acts 10:34 where Peter states God shows no partiality.

questions.question: In James 2:2-3, what attitude toward the rich and poor is condemned?
options: Showing favoritism to the rich over the poor
Welcoming the poor more than the rich
questions.correctAnswer: Showing favoritism to the rich over the poor
questions.explanation: James 2:2-3 condemns giving preferential treatment to a man with fine clothing and a gold ring over a poor man in shabby clothes. This reflects God's concern for justice as seen in Proverbs 22:2 and Deuteronomy 10:17.

questions.question: What question does James ask in 2:4 regarding partiality?
options: Are ye not then partial in yourselves, and judges of evil thoughts?
Do you love your neighbor as yourself?
Are you justified by works or faith?
questions.correctAnswer: Are ye not then partial in yourselves, and judges of evil thoughts?
questions.explanation: James 2:4 challenges believers by exposing partiality as judging evil thoughts within themselves. This echoes Proverbs 24:12 about God knowing the heart and Romans 2:1 condemning judgment without mercy.

questions.question: According to James 2:5, whom has God chosen as rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom?
questions.correctAnswer: The poor of this world
questions.explanation: James 2:5 states God has chosen the poor of this world to be rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom. This reflects Jesus’ teaching in Matthew 5:3, the Beatitudes, and Isaiah 61:1-3 about the exaltation of the humble.

questions.question: What behavior toward the poor do believers exhibit according to James 2:6?
questions.correctAnswer: Despising the poor
questions.explanation: James 2:6 rebukes believers for despising the poor, while rich men oppress them and bring them before judges. This injustice is condemned in Proverbs 22:22-23 and Luke 4:18-19 where God defends the oppressed.

questions.question: James 2:8 refers to fulfilling the royal law. What is this law?
options: Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself
Thou shalt keep the Sabbath holy
Thou shalt honor thy father and mother
questions.correctAnswer: Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself
questions.explanation: James 2:8 identifies the royal law as loving one's neighbor as oneself, quoting Leviticus 19:18. Jesus also affirms this as the greatest commandment in Matthew 22:39 and Romans 13:9.

questions.question: What does James say about the sin of showing partiality in 2:9?
options: It is a sin and transgresses the law
questions.correctAnswer: It is a sin and transgresses the law
questions.explanation: James 2:9 states that showing partiality is sin and makes one a transgressor of the law. This is consistent with Deuteronomy 1:17 and Romans 2:11 that God shows no partiality and forbids favoritism.

questions.question: How does James 2:10 describe the law and sin?
options: Offending in one point makes a person guilty of all the law
Only some laws must be kept
Sin is not related to the law
questions.correctAnswer: Offending in one point makes a person guilty of all the law
questions.explanation: James 2:10 teaches that breaking one commandment makes a person guilty of violating the entire law. This reflects Jesus' summary of the law in Matthew 5:19 and Paul’s teaching in Galatians 3:10.

questions.question: According to James 2:12, how should believers speak and act?
options: As those who will be judged by the law of liberty
questions.correctAnswer: As those who will be judged by the law of liberty
questions.explanation: James 2:12 instructs believers to speak and act as those who will be judged by the law of liberty, referring to the law of love and grace. This is consistent with John 8:32 and Romans 8:1-4 about freedom in Christ.

questions.question: What principle does James 2:13 teach about mercy and judgment?
options: Judgment without mercy will be shown to those who show no mercy
Mercy must be withheld from sinners
questions.correctAnswer: Judgment without mercy will be shown to those who show no mercy
questions.explanation: James 2:13 teaches that those who show no mercy will receive judgment without mercy, emphasizing mercy’s triumph over judgment, echoing Matthew 5:7 and Luke 6:36.

questions.question: What question does James 2:14 raise about faith and works?
options: Can faith save a man who has no works?
Is faith unnecessary if there are works?
Are works more important than faith?
Can works alone save a man?
questions.correctAnswer: Can faith save a man who has no works?
questions.explanation: James 2:14 questions the profit of faith without works, challenging the notion that faith alone can save. This complements Jesus' teaching in Matthew 7:21 and Paul’s emphasis on faith with works in Galatians 5:6.

questions.question: What example does James 2:15-16 give to illustrate dead faith?
options: Saying to a destitute brother, ‘Depart in peace,’ without providing for his needs
Praying for the sick without visiting them
questions.correctAnswer: Saying to a destitute brother, ‘Depart in peace,’ without providing for his needs
questions.explanation: James 2:15-16 illustrates faith without works as dead by describing telling a hungry and naked person to go in peace without meeting physical needs. This aligns with Proverbs 21:13 and 1 John 3:17.

questions.question: According to James 2:17, what is the nature of faith without works?
questions.correctAnswer: Dead
questions.explanation: James 2:17 states that faith without works is dead, emphasizing that genuine faith produces action. This parallels Jesus’ teaching in John 15:5 and Paul’s exhortation in Ephesians 2:8-10.

questions.question: In James 2:18, how is faith demonstrated according to James’ challenge?
questions.correctAnswer: By showing faith through works
questions.explanation: James 2:18 challenges believers to demonstrate faith by works, indicating that works are the evidence of true faith. This is consistent with Matthew 7:16 and Galatians 5:22-23 on fruit of faith.

questions.question: What example of justification by works does James give in 2:21-23?
options: Abraham offering Isaac upon the altar
questions.correctAnswer: Abraham offering Isaac upon the altar
questions.explanation: James 2:21-23 uses Abraham’s offering of Isaac as an example of faith completed by works, demonstrating justification. This aligns with Genesis 22 and Paul’s reference in Romans 4:3-5 about faith credited for righteousness.
